867452593815138304.text: Better(?) idea: modified bcrypt is externally detectable, but an API like PHP password_hash() leaking a fast hash into salt is undetectable

860176044241936386.text: Is everyone working on their @UnderCrypto submissions?

846077165393338368.text: Free @UnderCrypto idea: Build a signing function that leaks the private key when entropy is restricted. Oh, wait, that's just (EC)DSA.

846076565943390209.text: Free @UnderCrypto idea: Build a password "hashing" algorithm that hides a NOBUS decryption function (think EC_DRBG).

846075284449382402.text: Free @UnderCrypto idea: modify bcrypt/scrypt/etc to embed a simple verifier so a cracker can short circuit processing on incorrect passwords

843382644939374592.text: left as an exercise: design a backdoor that exploits "zero width space" characters (http://unicode.scarfboy.com/?s=E2808B ) in source code

574333888689913858.text: Thanks very much to our sponsors @NCCCrypto and @LeastAuthority for supporting the contest. It wouldn't have happened without them.

574331777176576000.text: The winners have been decided! Emails with Round 2 and Round 3 results will be sent to the contestants shortly. Sorry for the delays.

564289164523229184.text: The Round 2 scores have been tallied. The numbers are close. We just asked the judges to confirm the submissions going into Round 3.

563835575916953601.text: Terribly sorry for the delays! The results of round 2 will come out this weekend, and the last round will begin shortly.

552350131711131649.text: Email has gone out to all contestants. Check your inboxes to see if your submission made it to Round 2.

552334467759882240.text: The judges' votes for Round 1 are in! Contestants will be notified if their submission has made it into Round 2 shortly.

547034076511617025.text: We're extending the winner announcement to January 30th to make sure the judges have time to enjoy their holidays. Thanks for your patience!

539827847427551232.text: Last call for submissions! If you're going to submit, now's the time!
